brief_summary.textblock:
Long-term objectives of the basic research part are improvement of CAP-management with
      respect to therapy, diagnosis and prevention to contribute to a better care of patients with
      pneumonia.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidemiological Study on Community Acquired Pneumonia

detailed_description.textblock:
Long-term objectives of the basic research part are improvement of CAP-management with
      respect to therapy, diagnosis and prevention to contribute to a better care of patients with
      pneumonia. The aim of the study CAPNETZ is to improve diagnosis, treatment and patient care.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age ≥ 18

          -  infiltrate on chest X-ray

          -  further Inclusion criteria: cough or production of purulent sputum or pathologic lung
             auscultation (crackles) or fever

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  hospital inpatient treatment within the last 28 days

          -  Immune suppressed patients

keyword: cough or production of purulent sputum
clinical_study.official_title: Epidemiological Study on Community Acquired Pneumonia

authority: Ethik-Kommission der Otto-von-Guericke-Universität Magdeburg: Germany, Medizinische Hochschule

primary_outcome.description:
Assessment of diagnosis:
Patients will be asked for example, about their diagnosis, comorbidities, specific risk factors and pneumonia symptoms.

Assessment of therapy:
Patients will be asked about their therapy due to pneumonia symptoms, previous therapy, medication History etc.

Assessment of hospitalization:
Patients will be asked about hospitalization, date, time and duration of hospitalization due to pneumonia symptoms.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
